flowRoot.flowPara: Step 1: Request comes in to rails.
Step 2: API call to streamline determines auth level
S3 cache is used to store user and application information
Common info includes app name, domain name, UUID, framework type, etc.
S3 also stores what apps are running on what nodes
Mcollective uses qpid to get a list of available nodes and their current load (calucluated by us, not unix load).
New apps get created on nodes with the least load
custom express agent is called from mcollective to issue configure/start/stop/deconfigure, etc scripts from the cartridges
mcollective also has a "direct" communiation method which is faster then the default poll/timeout method
